title: These sub-modules give a summary of the operation of fixed e…
caption_en: These sub-modules give a summary of the operation of fixed emergency equipment. For a detailed description of the Oxygen and Emergency Lighting systems, return to the Main menu and select the Oxygen and Airplane General titles respectively.

title: The passenger oxygen system is controlled by the Pax Oxy Aut…
caption_en: The passenger oxygen system is controlled by the Pax Oxy Auto and the Pax Deploy switch indicators. When both switch indicators are blank, the system is armed for automatic deployment.

title: If the cabin altitude exceeds feet, the passenger oxygen sys…
caption_en: If the cabin altitude exceeds feet, the passenger oxygen system will then be turned on automatically.

title: If the aircraft is operated with the Pax Oxy Auto switch ind…
caption_en: If the aircraft is operated with the Pax Oxy Auto switch indicator showing OFF, the passenger oxygen system will not be able to turn on automatically.

title: The passenger oxygen system may be turned on at any time by …
caption_en: The passenger oxygen system may be turned on at any time by depressing the Pax Deploy switch indicator.

title: Whenever the passenger oxygen system is turned on, automatic…
caption_en: Whenever the passenger oxygen system is turned on, automatically or manually, the Pax Deploy switch indicator will illuminate ON and a Pax Oxy Deploy message will be displayed on EICAS.

title: After the passenger oxygen system has been turned on, the sy…
caption_en: After the passenger oxygen system has been turned on, the system may be reset, if conditions permit, by depressing the Pax Deploy switch indicator. The switch indicator should then be blank.

title: The observer's oxygen system is currently operated by select…
caption_en: The observer's oxygen system is currently operated by selecting the observer's switch indicator so that it illuminates ON.

title: Crew mask regulators are set at the precent position for fli…
caption_en: Crew mask regulators are set at the precent position for flight. This provides for percent oxygen flow on demand.

title: When required, the selector is set to Emergency position. Ox…
caption_en: When required, the selector is set to Emergency position. Oxygen flow will be percent under pressure.

title: If armed, the emergency lights automatcially turn on when bo…
caption_en: If armed, the emergency lights automatcially turn on when both engine generators fail or if the passenger oxygen system is deployed.

title: Emergency lights may be turned on at any time by selecting t…
caption_en: Emergency lights may be turned on at any time by selecting the emergency lights switch to ON.

title: The emergency lighting system turns on the following lights.
caption_en: The emergency lighting system turns on the following lights.

title: An Emergency Locator Transmitter or ELT is fitted in the tai…
caption_en: An Emergency Locator Transmitter or ELT is fitted in the tailcone area.

title: The switch is left in the ARM position and in this position …
caption_en: The switch is left in the ARM position and in this position the system is armed. A high impact force will automatically turn the transmitter on.

title: The transmitter may also be turned on at any time by selecti…
caption_en: The transmitter may also be turned on at any time by selecting the cockpit switch to ON.

title: Whenever the transmitter is turned on, the indicator light f…
caption_en: Whenever the transmitter is turned on, the indicator light flashes. A buzzer in the transmitter will sound intermittently.

title: This transmitter transmits on and megahertz.
caption_en: This transmitter transmits on and megahertz.
